I gotta say. You fixed everything. I heard the game was playable on Chromebook so I thought something changed. And it did. Sprinting no longer feels like trying to walk a drunk man. There's no little turn after taking your finger off the screen. And my favorite part, being able to load my saved game. The new interface is new. The old one was fine but the new one lacks that certain aesthetic. Overall very cool. Thanks Bethesda.
Game is obviously legendary. My controller is working now correctly and the game seems to be running smooth on my device. Great classic to finally enjoy on mobile.

Currently listed as a perk for Chromebook owners, but it doesn't support keyboard customization. Right clicking touchpad to fire is awkward. If I wanted to play this with a controller, I'd just fire up my PS4. You're better off paying for Delta Touch, which will work with a keyboard just fine. This review applies to Doom as well.

UPDATE: 4/5 stars because this game *finally* feels like classic Doom with proper input support. --- OG Review: Gamepad/Mouse support essentially doesn't exist. How is this "Classic Doom" without basic input controls? Sad they don't give us the option to turn touch controls on/off. Regarding getting the mouse to work, I went back-and-forth with Bethesda for a few days with zero luck and now I'm denied a refund from both Bethesda and Google... great.

*Update 20200604* Old save files still crash the game to the home screen. Controls have improved immensely and with Xbox controller support I'm young this faithful port to 4/5. Keep up the great work and continue to improve this iconic game!

Thank you so much Nerve and Bethesda for following through with new content and fixes that add much value to the game. Much appreciated.

This is the best official Bethesda/Id version of the classic Doom for phone, it supports WADs! They finally added controller support too, so you can now plug in a controller (and you should, since touch controls are understandably not great for FPS). Although there are better unofficial ports out there, this is the only one that bundles the official Doom2 Wad as well including Final Doom (Plutonia & TNT) and "No rest for the living" expansion, in addition to the Master Levels. All for 5 bucks. So I think it deserves the 5 stars.

This port of Doom is a disappointment to fans of the series, here's a list of issues with the port itself: logging in to a Bethesda account is required upon launching, lack of option to customise controls, no option to change size or transparency of thumpad that takes up screen space when moving, no option to turn off annoying artwork that takes up spaces on both sides of screen, no option to choose which chapter or level to play for maximum replay ability, shooting feels awkward and unreliable.

It's Doom, so it's still fun and amazing. Except there are no options to change anything in the game except movement speed and Always Run. The controls are terrible and the input lag feels something like 200ms. The controls are setup in "fields" where the left side is movement, the middle is action, and the right is move/shoot. Needs aiming joystick and separate button for shooting. Tap is AWFUL. Swiping to aim has inertia so it feels jittery and messes up aiming a LOT. Makes it no fun and hard.

Controls are HORRID. Being required to aim and shoot with the same stick makes the game almost impossible to play as your aim flinches with each shot. Controls should be modeled after the existing IOS Doom release, which was much better. Controls make the game basically unplayable for me, which is a shame because this is probably my favorite game ever.

Rather than the player playing through three related episodes as in the first Doom, gameplay takes place over one giant episode, albeit with interludes for when the story develops. Instead of watching the player's progress on a map (as in the original episodes of Doom), the screens between each level simply show a background (a style carried over to the bonus fourth episode of Doom available in The Ultimate Doom, the retail re-release of the original Doom).
